author: Shiv Sunny
text:
Police say Adarsh Sharma has admitted it was all a publicity stunt

Adarsh Sharma has been booked for abetment of offence, criminal intimidation, forgery and cheating.— photo: shiv sunny

: Facing severe criticism for going “soft” on Adarsh Sharma, the man who placed a bounty on student leader Kanhaiya Kumar, the Delhi police on Monday arrested him after booking him for several offences.

Since the police pressed some non-bailable charges against Mr. Sharma, he continued to remain under arrest on Monday.

Claiming to be the president of a little-known Purvanchal Sena, Mr. Sharma had on Saturday put up posters announcing a reward of Rs. 11 lakh to anyone who would shoot Mr. Kumar.

Based on a written complaint, the police on Saturday had booked him for defacement of property. With the action drawing ridicule, police added five more criminal sections against him, including forgery, cheating and using a forged document.

Early on in his interrogation, Mr. Sharma maintained that he had declared the reward because of his “love for the country.”
title: Man behind posters against Kanhaiya arrested
